result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Beau M Snowden

records.addlTxt: Hearing on December 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

10:48 AM Defendant Beau M Snowden in court.  Attorney Craig Michael Kuhary in court for Beau M Snowden. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. 

First appearance with Judge. Defense has discovery and an offer from the State. Defense is in process of reviewing discovery, there is several hours of video. State does not object. Court sets status hearing.
Hearing scheduled for December 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on October 24, 2022 at 10:30 am.

7:53 AM Defendant Beau M Snowden appeared by Zoom.  Attorney Craig Michael Kuhary appeared by Zoom for Beau M Snowden.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea M Will in court for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. 

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Request for Atty Kuhary and Defendant to appear by Zoom **Reviewed by Commissioner Daniel Rieck on 9/12 "Approved. Waiver was filed within 48 hours of hearing"
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
Preliminary hearing on September 14, 2022 at 10:15 am.

10:14 AM Defendant Beau M Snowden in court.  Attorney Craig Michael Kuhary in court for Beau M Snowden. District Attorney Law Intern in court for State of Wisconsin.Preliminary Hearing requested. Preliminary time limits waived.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Attorney Craig Kuhary

Adjustment Number: 22A 029199,
Payable Number: 470609,
Amount: $20.00
Hearing on August 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:20 AM Defendant Beau M Snowden in court, in custody.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  The defendant states he will be posting bail today and will retain private counsel.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Motion and Order To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key.
Signed by Judge Brad D. Schimel on 07/06/2022.

ADDRESS INFO for Beau M Snowden
Current: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 07-05-2022)
Prior: 2801 N University Dr,43, Waukesha, WI 53188
Hearing on July 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.

If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes. Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with victims A-D (unless they initiate contact or in an emergency fashion) listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.    Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.    Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.

04:34 PM Defendant Beau M Snowden in court, in custody, with State Public Defender Law Intern, as a friend of the court.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.

The Court recalls the matter at 04:47 PM with the same appearances, less the Defendant as he was taken back into jail.
The Court orders that If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.
